LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.NudistsIgnore.Title: Nudists ignore utilities
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.NudistsIgnore.Descripti: By default, anything worn on the legs or torso will upset nudists unless specially marked. This setting allows them to wear all utilities without consequence.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.NoDamageUtilities.Title: Equipment ignores damage
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.NoDamageUtilities.Descr: If enabled, apparel on the equipment layers will not take damage in combat.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.LegacySmokepop.Title: Legacy smokepop
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.LegacySmokepop.Descript: (REQUIRES RESTART) Before 1.4, the smokepop pack had a more belt-like appearance, and so was treated like a belt. Enabling this setting will put it back on the belt area.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.Bandolier.Title: Use ammunition layer for Biotech bandolier
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.Bandolier.Description: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, the bandolier from Biotech will become wearable with outer apparel, like coats and armor. Almost certainly unbalanced, but have your own fun.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.Mechanitor.Title: Biotech - Use mechanitor layer
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.Mechanitor.Description: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, mechanitor packs will have their own layer, and can be worn with any other utilities. Includes packs from: Alpha Mechs.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.RimmunationTwo.Title: Use tactical layer for Rimmu-Nation 2
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.RimmunationTwo.Descript: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, all webbings and belts from Rimmu-nation 2 will be moved to a special "tactical" layer. This will make them wearable with other types of equipment.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.EftTactical.Title: Use tactical layer for [JDS] EFT Apparel (non-armor)
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.EftTactical.Description: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, all non-armor chest-rigs from [JDS] EFT Apparel will be moved to a special "tactical" layer. This will make them wearable with other types of equipment.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.EftArmor.Title: Use tactical layer for [JDS] EFT Apparel (armor)
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.EftArmor.Description: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, all armored chest-rigs from [JDS] EFT Apparel will be moved to a special "tactical" layer. This will make them wearable with other types of equipment.\n\nThis basically lets you wear armor on top of armor. Completely unbalanced, but you do you.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.RimEffectAmmo.Title: Use ammunition layer for Rim-Effect ammo belts
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.RimEffectAmmo.Descripti: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, all ammo belts from Rim-Effect: Core will be moved to the "Ammunition" layer.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.AccessoriesExpanded.Tit: Use ammunition layer for VAE Accessories
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.AccessoriesExpanded.Des: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, the ammo pack and quiver will be moved to the "Ammunition" layer.
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.ArtifactLayer.Title: Use artifact layer
LanguageData.PacksAreNotBelts.ArtifactLayer.Descripti: (REQUIRES RESTART) If enabled, certain artifacts like the shock and insanity lances will be moved to their own layer. Modded artifacts may or may not be supported, depending on how the mod's author configured them.
